intro: Pentataphrus behrii, commonly known as the Behri's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
